CatDescriptText: Signs read "Vote the Regular Democratic Ticket, City of Pittsburgh Mayor David L. Lawrence; Members of Council: Thomas J. Gallagher, Bennett Rodgers, David Olbum, Patrick T. Fagan, Frederic G. Weir, Irma M. D'Ascenzo; Allegheny County Judge of the Court of Common Pleas: A. Marshall Thompson, Harry M. Montgomery, Homer S. Brown, William F. Cercone, Henry Ellenbogen, John J. Kennedy; Judge of the Orphan's Court: A. L. Wolk, Judge of the County Court: John G. Brosky, Sheriff: William H. Davis, Coroner: Dr. Wm D. McClelland; Clerk of Courts: Thomas E. Barrett; Member of Commission for the Selection of Jurors: Jean Rankin Meanor; County Surveyor: Hiram Milton", and "Vote for Patrick J. Corr, Democratic Candidate for Judge..."Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 25, 1957, pg. A3, reads: "Pat Corr's Plan - This advertisement in 16th District of the Fifth Ward polling place (similar to others in the Hill District) was part of Pat Corr's bid to win nomination for Judge of Common Pleas Court Tuesday. Placing this display card beside that of the regular Democratic ticket, indicated his support of all endorsed candidates except the judges.  In spite of this and help from employers of Prothonotary David B. Roberts office, latest unofficial returns show the strategy failed, and Mr. Corr trailed the six incumbent judges. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Political campaign signs for Democratic ticket, including David L. Lawrence for mayor, and Patrick Corr for Judge, on brick building at polling place
